Reported to House (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept.99-703, Part I. of the Committee pursuant to clause 1(1), Rule X.

Referred sequentially to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs for a period ending not later than Sept. 17, 1990 for consideration of such provisions of the bill and amendment as fall within the jurisdiction of the Committee pursuant to clause 1(1), Rule X.

actions.subcommittee: Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources.
Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs discharged.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 450.
Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Young (AK) demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Became Public Law No: 101-622.

official_title: To authorize modification of the boundaries of the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge.

summary.text: Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to accept, in exchange (by quitclaim deed) for the surface and subsurface estate of certain other lands, from Koniag, Incorporated, a conveyance by limited warranty deed of the surface and subsurface estates of specified lands on Kodiak Island, Alaska, to be included in the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge. Subjects the conveyed lands to the same restrictions and limitations placed on previous lands conveyed to Koniag, pursuant to an agreement between it and the Commandant of the U.S. Coast Guard (to protect the U.S. Coast Guard Holiday Beach receiver site).

titles.title: To authorize modification of the boundaries of the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge.
